intro: Ceropegia oculatoides, commonly known as the "Cape violets," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a succulent species characterized by its fleshy, tuberous stems and fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with intricate patterns. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Ceropegia oculatoides prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
